      • computeDistance

        public static int computeDistance(java.lang.String text1,
                  java.lang.String text2,
                  boolean caseSensitive,
                  java.lang.String wordDelimiters)
        Compute "distance" between two texts.
        To compute how "far" are the tow texts, we take all words of each and if a word of one not exits in the other, we decide they are more far than if the word is in the second but not in the same place. If the word is in same place, we say distance is zero
        Parameters:
        text1 - First text
        text2 - Second text
        caseSensitive - Indicates if for word comparison case is important or not
        wordDelimiters - List of delimiters of words (Each characters of this string are see as separator and only them)
        Returns:
        The computed distance

        The index will be 26 (not 6)

      • replaceHole

        public static java.lang.String replaceHole(java.lang.String originalString,
                           java.lang.String... replacement)
        Replace "hole" by a value.
        holes are like {0}, {8}, ... That means that the first replacement replace every holes {0}, then ninth every {8}, ...
        Example:
        originalString
        replacement
        result
        I want exchange this {0} with this {1} hammer, apple I want exchange this hammer with this apple
        I saw a {0} run after a {1}. I wonder if the {1} can escape from the {0} dog, cat I saw a dog run after a cat. I wonder if the cat can escape from the dog
        Parameters:
        originalString - String with "holes"
        replacement - List of replacement for "holes". First replace hole {0}, second {1}, third {2} ,....
        Returns:
        Result string with replacement

      • replaceSeveral

        public static java.lang.String replaceSeveral(java.lang.String originalString,
                              int... values)
        Replace holes like {0} or {2_s} or {1_###eet} or ... depends of the given numbers.
        If the word just before the {, need to be change if the number is at least 2, then put after the hole number the character _. If the rule is just to add a s, by example, like 1 cat, 2 cats, just put after the _, the letters to add. Example : cat{3_s}, means if the fourth number is under 2, the word will be cat and id the fourth number is 2 or more, the word will become cats. But it exist some case or just add letters is no enough, like 1 foot, 2 feet. In this case, just put some # character after the _ followed by the letters to add. The number of last letter you want remove from the original word corresponds to the number of # to put. By example, for foot become feet, we have to remove the 3 last letters (So have to put 3 #) then add letters "eet", so have to write : foot{2_###eet}. That's means if third number is under 2, foot is write, and if third number is 2 or over, foot is write, and 3 last letters are removed (Because of the 3 #) and "eet" is add, so its become feet. Examples:
        originalString
        replacement
        result
        There {0} cat{0_s} and {1} foot{1_###eet} 1, 1 There 1 cat and 1 foot
        There {0} cat{0_s} and {1} foot{1_###eet} 5,1 There 5 cats and 1 foot
        There {0} cat{0_s} and {1} foot{1_###eet} 1,3 There 1 cat and 3 feet
        There {0} cat{0_s} and {1} foot{1_###eet} 5, 3 There 5 cats and 3 feet
        Parameters:
        originalString - String with "holes"
        values - List of values for "holes". First evaluate hole {0}, second {1}, third {2} ,....
        Returns:
        Result string with replacement
